API¶

calculator.multiply_three(x1, x2, x3)¶

Multiply three numbers

Parameters:
  • x1 (float) – First number
  • x2 (float) – Second number
  • x3 (float) – Third number
Returns:

multiplication
Return type:

float
Example: 
>>> multiply_three(1, 2,3)
6
>>> sum(1.1, 1.2, 1.3)
1.716
calculator.subtract(n1, n2)¶

Subtract one number to the other

Parameters:
  • n1 (float) – First number
  • n2 (float) – Second number
Returns:

subtraction of two arguments
Return type:

float
Example: 
>>> subtract(1, 2)
-1
>>> subtract(-1, 100)
-101
calculator.sum(n1, n2)¶

Add one number to the other

Parameters:
  • n1 (float) – First number
  • n2 (float) – Second number
Returns:

sum of two arguments
Return type:

float
Example: 
>>> sum(1, 2)
3
>>> sum(-1, 100)
99
